content.description:
Start on any of a selection of good holds on the lip of the overhanging face far left. Follow good holds traversing right along the lip with small feet on the overhanging face

until you need to throw for the broken corner jug and let feet come loose. Get a hand heel match and mantel, top out.
content.location: Start on the lower left corner of the lip of the overhanging face

content.description: Start matched on the left side of the cutout corner around the left side of the overhanging face. Move to the right wall of the corner and reach for the lip. Manage less than ideal hands and feet you cant see to move yourself up. Awkward exposed move up over the lip.
content.protection: 1-2 pads, a spotter might be nice.
content.location: Down around the left corner of the overhanging face.

content.description: Start matched on an incut section on the left side of the lip above the cutout, feet on the overhanging section under the cutout (small wall to the right is off). Bump hands up and right to good hold, get a left foot above the lip and find holds to stand up on it. Finish by topping out a slightly delicate slab with decent holds if you look for them. Rock seemed solid but the edges of some holds on the bottom may crumble and round as it cleans up. Fun movement, goes at V0-1 if you use feet or hands on the right wall to start.
content.location: Roughly 100 feet SE of the overhanging face. Its a cutout section below a slab. Will update with pictures.

content.description: Start with wide hands on incut but small holds, small smeary feet. Press hard with the feet and bump a hand up high, then another bump for the other hand. Hard to describe beta. This thing is stiff.
content.location: On the Gneiss overhanging face just left of the small tree.

content.description: Start as for "Negative Space" But move straight up from the start
Start at the small gully in the rock just left of the cutout corner. Work up the face on easy smearing and dirty jugs.

Shaded rock outcropping that faces south and gets winter sun into the late afternoon. The rock is very very solid gneiss, grippy and reliable. One overhanging (20ish degrees) face with hard, short, quality climbs and some other isolated spots worth climbing. Be careful climbing on the overhanging face, I found 2 old rusted timber nails banged into a couple cracks. I broke them off at the base near the rock and didn't see any more but its worth keeping your eyes open.
